analyzed: ngan 'das par 'gro ba'i drang lam stobs lnga po //
translated: “The Sage has taught the five powers, the straight path that leads to the nirvāṇa of the buddhas,

original: de dag nyon mongs zad bgyid thar par bgyid ces ston pa thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs zad bgyid thar par bgyid ces ston pa thub pas gsungs //
translated: Which bring about the exhaustion of afflictions and liberation.

original: de dag rang bzhin ma mchis nyon mongs ma mchis rgyal ba ma mchis te //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin ma mchis nyon mongs ma mchis rgyal ba ma mchis te //
translated: They are essenceless, without afflictions, and without victors.

original: thub pa bdag cag gang la'ang the tshom ma mchis de slad khyod la mchod //
analyzed: thub pa bdag cag gang la'ang the tshom ma mchis de slad khyod la mchod //
translated: Sage, we have no doubts about any of this, and so we make offerings to you.

original: byang chub yan lag bdun po 'di dag dge ba lam gyi dam pa ste //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag bdun po 'di dag dge ba lam gyi dam pa ste //
translated: These seven factors of awakening are the sublime path of virtue,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan 'das 'gro'i drang lam mchog ces thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan 'das 'gro'i drang lam mchog ces thub pas gsungs //
translated: The supreme straight path to the transcendence of suffering of the buddhas, so the Sage has said.

original: 'ching ba mchis pa ma lags grol ba ma mchis bcings pa'ang ma mchis te //
analyzed: 'ching ba mchis pa ma lags grol ba ma mchis bcings pa'ang ma mchis te //
translated: There is no bondage, no freedom, and no one bound,

original: sems can dkon mchog 'di la bdag cag the tshom ma mchis khyod la mchod //
analyzed: sems can dkon mchog 'di la bdag cag the tshom ma mchis khyod la mchod //
translated: And so, O Jewel of Beings, we have no doubts about this, and so we make offerings to you.

original: rkang gnyis gtso bo khyod kyis bzhi phrag gnyis lam sems can rnams la bstan //
analyzed: rkang gnyis gtso bo khyod kyis bzhi phrag gnyis lam sems can rnams la bstan //
translated: O Foremost of Humans, you have taught beings the path of the four pairs,

original: brtson 'grus ldan par 'phags lam sdug bsngal mthar mar 'byin pa sgoms zhes gsungs //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan par 'phags lam sdug bsngal mthar mar 'byin pa sgoms zhes gsungs //
translated: And said, “Meditate on the noble path endowed with diligence, and put an end to suffering.”

original: mi mchog lam dang de bzhin nyon mongs 'di gnyis g-yo ba ma mchis te //
analyzed: mi mchog lam dang de bzhin nyon mongs 'di gnyis g-yo ba ma mchis te //
translated: O Supreme One among Men, this path and these afflictions are both unmoving,

original: 'di la lha tshogs the tshom ma mchis gyur pas mchod 'os khyod la mchod //
analyzed: 'di la lha tshogs the tshom ma mchis gyur pas mchod 'os khyod la mchod //
translated: The assembly of gods has no doubt about this, and so they worship you, who are worthy of worship.

original: 'dod chags gnyen por zhi gnas bka' stsal zhe sdang gnyen por byams pa gsungs //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyen por zhi gnas bka' stsal zhe sdang gnyen por byams pa gsungs //
translated: The antidote to desire is taught to be śamatha, and the antidote to anger is taught to be love.

original: gti mug gnyen por lhag mthong thub pa mchog gis sems can rnams la bstan //
analyzed: gti mug gnyen por lhag mthong thub pa mchog gis sems can rnams la bstan //
translated: The antidote to ignorance is taught to be vipaśyanā. The supreme Sage taught this to sentient beings.

original: 'di dag thams cad g-yo ba ma mchis skad cig dag @216b min nyon mongs min //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad g-yo ba ma mchis skad cig dag @216b min nyon mongs min //
translated: None of these are moving, momentary, or afflictive.

original: 'di la lha tshogs the tshom ma mchis thub pa mchod slad rtag tu brtson //
analyzed: 'di la lha tshogs the tshom ma mchis thub pa mchod slad rtag tu brtson //
translated: The assembly of gods has no doubt about this, and so they always strive to worship the Sage.

original: sdug bsngal zhi bya phyir ni zhi gnas lhag mthong lam yang sgoms zhes gsungs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi bya phyir ni zhi gnas lhag mthong lam yang sgoms zhes gsungs //
translated: In order to pacify suffering, cultivate the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: bcom ldan gang gis 'gro ba nyon mongs bag chags bcas dri de dag zhi //
analyzed: bcom ldan gang gis 'gro ba nyon mongs bag chags bcas dri de dag zhi //
translated: The Bhagavān has pacified the afflictions of beings, along with their traces.

original: thub pa zhi gnas lhag mthong de bzhin dri ma thams cad stong pa ste //
analyzed: thub pa zhi gnas lhag mthong de bzhin dri ma thams cad stong pa ste //
translated: The Sage has pacified śamatha and vipaśyanā, and likewise all stains are empty.

original: 'di la lha tshogs gang du'ang the tshom ma mchis skyon bral khyod la mchod //
analyzed: 'di la lha tshogs gang du'ang the tshom ma mchis skyon bral khyod la mchod //
translated: The assembly of gods has no doubt about this, and so they worship you, who are free of faults.

original: stobs bcu sems can rnams la dge ba bcu yi las lam bstan mdzad de //
analyzed: stobs bcu sems can rnams la dge ba bcu yi las lam bstan mdzad de //
translated: The one with ten powers taught sentient beings the path of the ten virtues.🔽Killing, sexual activity, stealing, lying, slandering, harsh speech, idle talk,

original: gsod dang 'khrig dang ma byin phra ma rdzun dang zhe gcod kyal tshig dang // gnod sems dang ni mi rigs 'dod dang de bzhin log par rtog pa rnams //
analyzed: gsod dang 'khrig dang ma byin phra ma rdzun dang zhe gcod kyal tshig dang // gnod sems dang ni mi rigs 'dod dang de bzhin log par rtog pa rnams //
translated: Covetousness, harmful intent, and wrong views—🔽The Blessed One taught these unvirtuous actions to sentient beings.

original: mi dge'i las lam 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la bstan; ;sems can mi dmigs gsod pa ga la mchis te lhag ma de dang 'dra //
analyzed: mi dge'i las lam 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la bstan; ;sems can mi dmigs gsod pa ga la mchis te lhag ma de dang 'dra //
translated: Since sentient beings are not observed, how can there be killing? The rest are similar.

original: gnyen po dge ba ma mchis de ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste //
analyzed: gnyen po dge ba ma mchis de ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste //
translated: There are no virtuous antidotes, for they are empty by nature.

original: bde gshegs thub pa zag pa mi mnga' rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: bde gshegs thub pa zag pa mi mnga' rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
translated: Even the blissful, sage, and undefiled ones are empty by nature.

original: rnam 'dren the tshom som nyi ma mchis de slad khyod la phyag kyang 'tshal //
analyzed: rnam 'dren the tshom som nyi ma mchis de slad khyod la phyag kyang 'tshal //
translated: Since the guides are free from doubt and uncertainty, I pay homage to you.

original: sangs rgyas sras po dge ba'i blo can gang zhig spyod pa 'di bstan pa; ;mkhas pa kun tu dge ba nyid myong sdug bsngal myong bar yong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dge ba'i blo can gang zhig spyod pa 'di bstan pa; ;mkhas pa kun tu dge ba nyid myong sdug bsngal myong bar yong mi 'gyur //
translated: The wise ones experience only virtue and never experience suffering.

original: bcom ldan bde gshegs ye shes des ni tshul 'di bde bar thob par bgyis //
analyzed: bcom ldan bde gshegs ye shes des ni tshul 'di bde bar thob par bgyis //
translated: Blessed One, Sugata, through that wisdom, you have attained this method with ease.

original: 'di la lha tshogs @217a *//
analyzed: 'di la lha tshogs @217a *//
translated: Here, the assembly of gods

original: the tshom ma mchis mchod 'os khyod la mchod par 'tshal //
analyzed: the tshom ma mchis mchod 'os khyod la mchod par 'tshal //
translated: are worthy of worship, and I wish to make offerings to you.

original: de ltar dge rgyas kyis lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas cang mi zer bar 'khod do //
analyzed: de ltar dge rgyas kyis lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas cang mi zer bar 'khod do //
translated: In this way, after the gods of Puṇyaprasava praised the Blessed One, they remained silent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge rgyas kyi lha rnams cang mi zer bar 'khod pa yang mkhyen /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge rgyas kyi lha rnams cang mi zer bar 'khod pa yang mkhyen /
translated: Then the Blessed One knew that the gods of Puṇyaprasava were silent,

original: de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pas bsgrubs pa yang thugs su chud nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pas bsgrubs pa yang thugs su chud nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: and understanding their superior intention, he smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol ba /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol ba /
translated: Then the venerable Aśvajit spoke to the Blessed One in verse:

original: skye bo 'di kun bcom ldan khyod kyi mkhyen pa'i zil gyis zil mnan nas; ;bde gshegs rgyal ba mchog khyod kyis ni 'dzum pa mdzad 'di 'jig rten bstan //
analyzed: skye bo 'di kun bcom ldan khyod kyi mkhyen pa'i zil gyis zil mnan nas; ;bde gshegs rgyal ba mchog khyod kyis ni 'dzum pa mdzad 'di 'jig rten bstan //
translated: “All these people are overwhelmed by the splendor of your knowledge, O Blessed One. Sugata, supreme Victor, you have smiled, revealing this to the world.

original: rgyu ma mchis par chos kun mkhas pa rnams ni 'dzum pa mi mdzad na //
analyzed: rgyu ma mchis par chos kun mkhas pa rnams ni 'dzum pa mi mdzad na //
translated: The wise do not smile without reason, O you who know all phenomena.

original: 'dzum rgyu don gnyer mi mig med rnams la 'jig rten mkhas pas bka' stsal gsol //
analyzed: 'dzum rgyu don gnyer mi mig med rnams la 'jig rten mkhas pas bka' stsal gsol //
translated: The wise one of the world, please tell us the reason for your smile.

original: ma lus 'di dag thams cad gzhan du mi sems khyod 'dzum re zhing 'khod //
analyzed: ma lus 'di dag thams cad gzhan du mi sems khyod 'dzum re zhing 'khod //
translated: All of us here are waiting, not thinking of anything else.

original: dpal stug khyod la bstod pa bgyid cing nyan pa 'tshal ba'i yid kyis gnas //
analyzed: dpal stug khyod la bstod pa bgyid cing nyan pa 'tshal ba'i yid kyis gnas //
translated: We are present with minds eager to listen, praising you, O you who are rich in glory.

original: sangs rgyas gsung gi dbang phyug thos nas yid ni rab tu rangs gyur te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung gi dbang phyug thos nas yid ni rab tu rangs gyur te //
translated: Having heard the speech of the Lord of the Buddha, our minds are filled with joy.

original: chos rnams kun la nges pa'i blo dge ldan pa'i ston par skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la nges pa'i blo dge ldan pa'i ston par skye bar 'gyur //
translated: We will be born as teachers endowed with virtuous minds, with certainty in all phenomena.

original: bde gshegs mi mchog dge ba'i thugs can de ring su zhig blo gros bskyed //
analyzed: bde gshegs mi mchog dge ba'i thugs can de ring su zhig blo gros bskyed //
translated: O Sugata, supreme human, O you whose mind is virtuous, who will you inspire today?

original: de ring gang gis 'chi med zhi ba rtogs @217b shing phyogs rnams snang bar bgyis //
analyzed: de ring gang gis 'chi med zhi ba rtogs @217b shing phyogs rnams snang bar bgyis //
translated: Who today has realized the peace of immortality and illuminated the directions?

original: su zhig 'jig rten thugs brtse rgyal ba 'dren pa dpag tu med 'gyur ba //
analyzed: su zhig 'jig rten thugs brtse rgyal ba 'dren pa dpag tu med 'gyur ba //
translated: Who will become a compassionate Victorious One, a guide for the world, immeasurable?

original: de dag bka' stsol drang srong 'khor 'di legs par gsungs pas tshim par mdzod //
analyzed: de dag bka' stsol drang srong 'khor 'di legs par gsungs pas tshim par mdzod //
translated: Please tell us, and satisfy this assembly of sages with your excellent speech.

original: rgyal ba khyu mchog dge sbyong dam pa deng su btsun la dad pa skyes //
analyzed: rgyal ba khyu mchog dge sbyong dam pa deng su btsun la dad pa skyes //
translated: Victorious One, supreme among the virtuous, who today will give rise to faith in the noble ones?

original: bdud kyis mi 'phrog blo ldan gang zhig chos la yang dag yongs su gnas //
analyzed: bdud kyis mi 'phrog blo ldan gang zhig chos la yang dag yongs su gnas //
translated: Who, unwavering and wise, will abide perfectly in the Dharma, unswayed by Mara?

original: sangs rgyas sras po tshul mkhas gang zhig de ring nges pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po tshul mkhas gang zhig de ring nges pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: Who, a son of the Buddha, skilled in discipline, will attain certainty today?

original: rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag bka' stsol 'gro 'di the tshom ma mchis mdzod //
analyzed: rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag bka' stsol 'gro 'di the tshom ma mchis mdzod //
translated: Please tell us, O foremost among humans, and free this world from doubt.

original: bde gshegs deng su 'gro la dad bskyed skye rgu rnams la byams gyur cing //
analyzed: bde gshegs deng su 'gro la dad bskyed skye rgu rnams la byams gyur cing //
translated: Sugata, who today will generate faith in beings, be loving towards all,

original: byang chub mthar phyin blo gros brtan zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas //
analyzed: byang chub mthar phyin blo gros brtan zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas //
translated: and, having perfected enlightenment, abide in omniscience with a stable mind?

original: gang la 'dzum pa deng bstan bde gshegs bstan pa 'dzin pa de gang lags //
analyzed: gang la 'dzum pa deng bstan bde gshegs bstan pa 'dzin pa de gang lags //
translated: Who is the one who is smiling? Who is the one who upholds the teachings of the Sugata?

original: bsod nams brgya yi mtshan mnga' de dag bka' stsol bdag gi the tshom khum //
analyzed: bsod nams brgya yi mtshan mnga' de dag bka' stsol bdag gi the tshom khum //
translated: Please tell me, O one with the marks of a hundred merits, and remove my doubts.”

original: 'dren pa khyod gsung yan lag brgyad ldan legs par bka' stsal thos gyur na //
analyzed: 'dren pa khyod gsung yan lag brgyad ldan legs par bka' stsal thos gyur na //
translated: “O Guide, having heard your well-spoken words, which have eight aspects,

original: bde gshegs gsung gis thog mar bdag cag 'dong zhing 'gro ba gzhan yang 'dren //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsung gis thog mar bdag cag 'dong zhing 'gro ba gzhan yang 'dren //
translated: The speech of the Sugata first leads us and other beings.

original: de ltar gyur na bde gshegs bstan rab 'di ni sras la gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na bde gshegs bstan rab 'di ni sras la gnas par 'gyur //
translated: In that way, the teachings of the Sugata will remain with the heirs.

original: 'jig rten 'di dag yid ni myur du bde gshegs rnams la gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag yid ni myur du bde gshegs rnams la gnas par 'gyur //
translated: The minds of these worldly beings will quickly come to abide in the Sugata.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la tshigs su bcad de slar bka' stsal pa /🔽nga yi 'jig @218a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la tshigs su bcad de slar bka' stsal pa / nga yi 'jig @218a *//
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses in reply to the venerable Aśvajit:🔽“Aśvajit, you have seen me smile

original: rten don byed 'dzum mdzad rta thul khyod kyis mthong gyur cing //
analyzed: rten don byed 'dzum mdzad rta thul khyod kyis mthong gyur cing //
translated: While acting for the benefit of the world.

original: skyes bu dam pa khyod kyis dus su dris te 'gro ba'i don byas pa //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa khyod kyis dus su dris te 'gro ba'i don byas pa //
translated: You, a holy being, have asked at the right time and acted for the benefit of beings.

original: khyod kyi bsod nams 'phel ba brjod du med de de ni zad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi bsod nams 'phel ba brjod du med de de ni zad mi 'gyur //
translated: “Your merit will increase immeasurably, and it will never be exhausted.

original: de ni khyod la bstan gyi khyod dang 'gro ba 'di dag dga' bas nyon //
analyzed: de ni khyod la bstan gyi khyod dang 'gro ba 'di dag dga' bas nyon //
translated: I will teach it to you, so listen with joy, you and these beings.

original: dge rgyas lha tshogs 'di dag nga yi chos nyid la ni the tshom med //
analyzed: dge rgyas lha tshogs 'di dag nga yi chos nyid la ni the tshom med //
translated: “The hosts of gods in the Heaven of Perfect Virtue have no doubt about my Dharma.

original: kun kyang yi rang rab zhi yid kyis tshigs bcad dag gis nga la bsngags //
analyzed: kun kyang yi rang rab zhi yid kyis tshigs bcad dag gis nga la bsngags //
translated: They all rejoice, with minds of perfect peace, and praise me in verse.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong grangs mchod 'os mchod byas te //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong grangs mchod 'os mchod byas te //
translated: They have made offerings to the buddhas of the past, trillions of them, worthy of offerings.

original: the tshom med pa'i yid kyis tshul dris kun tu som nyi med par gyur //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i yid kyis tshul dris kun tu som nyi med par gyur //
translated: With minds free of doubt, they have asked about the way, and have become free of hesitation.

original: de ltar sngon gyi rgyu des 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pas nga la bstod //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi rgyu des 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pas nga la bstod //
translated: Because of those past causes, they now praise me in verse.

original: bskal pa bzang po'i rgyal ba bstod 'os kun la'ang 'di dag bstod par 'gyur //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i rgyal ba bstod 'os kun la'ang 'di dag bstod par 'gyur //
translated: They will also praise all the buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, who are worthy of praise.

original: 'di dag bskal pa autpal la la rgyal ba dgra rgyal mthu chen 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag bskal pa autpal la la rgyal ba dgra rgyal mthu chen 'gyur //
translated: In the eon called Utpalā, they will become victorious ones, conquerors of the enemy, with great power.

original: 'di dag sems can khrag khrig bsam yas yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar byed //
analyzed: 'di dag sems can khrag khrig bsam yas yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar byed //
translated: They will bring to nirvāṇa countless millions of beings.

original: sangs rgyas drang srong chen po de dag yid 'ong mtshan du gang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas drang srong chen po de dag yid 'ong mtshan du gang 'gyur ba //
translated: “Those buddhas, those great sages, will have pleasing names.

original: de yang bstan gyi dang ba'i yid kyis sems kyi tha ba spangs te nyon //
analyzed: de yang bstan gyi dang ba'i yid kyis sems kyi tha ba spangs te nyon //
translated: Listen with clear minds, and abandon all thoughts of hostility.

original: rgyal ba de kun chos kyi tog ces bya ba'i 'dren pa gzhal yas 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba de kun chos kyi tog ces bya ba'i 'dren pa gzhal yas 'gyur //
translated: All those jinas will be guides with the name Dharmaketu.

original: 'di dag re res kyang ni khrag khrig bsam yas mya ngan zlo bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag re res kyang ni khrag khrig bsam yas mya ngan zlo bar 'gyur //
translated: Each of them will bring to nirvāṇa countless millions.

original: de yi tshe na bde gshegs kun gyi ring bsrel shin tu rgyas 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi tshe na bde gshegs kun gyi ring bsrel shin tu rgyas 'gyur te //
translated: “At that time the relics of all those sugatas will be extensive.

original: de tshe zhing rnams @218b kun tu rgyal ba'i mchod rten me tog rgyas par 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe zhing rnams @218b kun tu rgyal ba'i mchod rten me tog rgyas par 'gyur //
translated: At that time, in all the realms, there will be the flowers of the jinas’ stūpas.

original: thub pa grags chen de dag yongs su mya ngan 'das par gyur pa na /
analyzed: thub pa grags chen de dag yongs su mya ngan 'das par gyur pa na /
translated: When those greatly famous sages have passed into nirvāṇa,

original: thub pa skyob pa de dag kun gyi ring bsrel rgyas pas don chen 'gyur //
analyzed: thub pa skyob pa de dag kun gyi ring bsrel rgyas pas don chen 'gyur //
translated: the relics of all those sages, those protectors, will be extensive and will be of great benefit.

original: sems can khrag khrig bsam yas rnams kyis de'i tshe ring bsrel mchod byas te //
analyzed: sems can khrag khrig bsam yas rnams kyis de'i tshe ring bsrel mchod byas te //
translated: Countless millions of beings will worship his relics.

original: ring bsrel de dag mchod nas mya ngan 'das pa zhi ba 'chi med 'thob //
analyzed: ring bsrel de dag mchod nas mya ngan 'das pa zhi ba 'chi med 'thob //
translated: Having worshipped his relics, they will attain the peace of nirvana, the deathless state.

original: thub pa rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag grags pa rgyun chad mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: thub pa rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag grags pa rgyun chad mi 'gyur te //
translated: The fame of those sages, best of humans, will not disappear.

original: slob pa khrag khrig bsam yas rnams kyang de tshe rgyal ba'i drung du 'du //
analyzed: slob pa khrag khrig bsam yas rnams kyang de tshe rgyal ba'i drung du 'du //
translated: Countless millions of disciples will gather around the Victor.

original: ji ltar bye ba brgya grangs nga la legs par spyad pa byas nas su //
analyzed: ji ltar bye ba brgya grangs nga la legs par spyad pa byas nas su //
translated: Just as the one hundred million of them have practiced well for me,

original: byams pa blta phyir rgya chen yid kyis byams pa'i 'khor du 'dong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byams pa blta phyir rgya chen yid kyis byams pa'i 'khor du 'dong 'gyur ba //
translated: they will go to Maitreya’s assembly with vast, loving minds, in order to see him.

original: de ltar rgyal ba'i nyan thos slob tshogs de dag rgyal nas rgyal 'khor du //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba'i nyan thos slob tshogs de dag rgyal nas rgyal 'khor du //
translated: In that way, the Victor’s assembly of disciples will be victorious, and will go to the Victor’s assembly

original: rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag kun gyi ring bsrel mchod pa bya phyir 'dong //
analyzed: rkang gnyis gtso bo de dag kun gyi ring bsrel mchod pa bya phyir 'dong //
translated: in order to worship the relics of all those best of humans.

original: bde gshegs gsung snyan 'gro ba thams cad ngo mtshar gyur pa des thos shing //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsung snyan 'gro ba thams cad ngo mtshar gyur pa des thos shing //
translated: They will hear the sweet speech of the Sugata, which amazes all beings.

original: dge rgyas ris kyi lha yi bdag nyid chen po de tshe thos gyur nas //
